project.description:
TODO Keywords: + AWT, Swing + JFrame
This project includes very simple examples involving Desktop UI.
AWTFrameTestRunner: Demonstrates how to create an AWT Frame with components on it. The close button does nothing so you should kill the app to terminate it.
JFrameTestRunner: Demonstrates how to create a simple JFrame with a label component on it. The close button terminates the application.
JFrameTestRunner: Demonstrates how to resize and position a JFrame on the top-right corner of the screen. It also creates a grid layout on the screen with three rows and two columns and add two labels with their corresponding textfields and a button.
SwingAppTestRunner: Shows how to extend from JFrame to construct a GUI, instead of creating a static method in your runner class. Typically, complex GUI apps will follow this pattern.
JLabelTestRunner: Demonstrates several actions that can be taken on JLabel components such as setting the text and font, using HTML tags, icons, etc.
JButtontestRunner: Demonstrates how to create a button with an image icon.
JTextFieldAndJPasswordFieldTestRunner: Demonstrates how to add a JTextField and a JPasswordField to a Swing frame.
JTextAreaTestRunner: Demonstrates how to add a JTextArea and a JTextArea in a JScrollPane in a frame.
JCheckBoxTestRunner: Demonstrates how to add several JCheckBoxes to a JFrame.
JListTest: Adds a JList to a JFrame.
JComboBoxTestRunner: Adds a JComboBox to a JFrame.
JDialogTestRunner: Demonstrates how to show a JDialog from a frame. The dialog is displayed when the user clicks on a JFrame button. In order to achieve that, an ActionListener is added to the button.
JOptionPaneMessageDialogTestRunner: Demonstrates how to display an informational, warning and error JOptionPane message dialog.
JOptionPaneConfirmDialogTestRunner: Demonstrates how to display a confirm dialog with a question. The response is then captured and showed on the console.
JOptionPaneInputDialogTestRunner: Demonstrates how to display a JOptionPane to get user input. First displaying a combobox and then a textfield.
